author: Mollie Russell
description:
New Dungeons and Dragons players face a far greater challenge than just learning how to play, and that’s finding someone to play with. There are many D&D-curious people out there who are too shy to play with strangers yet don’t have a committed group of existing friends to explore the TTRPG with. It’s no surprise, then, that publisher Wizards of the Coast has been trying to invent rules for single-player D&D for years.

Continue reading Dragon Delves is DnD's latest crack at two-player rules, but does it succeed?
MORE FROM WARGAMER: DnD 2024 Player's Handbook review, DnD classes guide, DnD races guide
title: Dragon Delves is DnD's latest crack at two-player rules, but does it succeed?

author: Timothy Linward
description:
On Wednesday, Wargamer had the great pleasure to welcome Aaron Ashbrooke, creative director at Auroch Digital and the visionary behind the excellent retro FPS Warhammer 40,000: Boltgun, to our Discord for an hour-long live AMA with our community. It was a blast - and in the course of fielding questions covering everything from Auroch Digital’s companywide obsession with Warhammer 40,000, to the delightfully bizarre Warhammer 40k typing game Words of Vengeance, Ashbrooke let us know some juicy tidbits about how the team is approaching Boltgun 2.

Continue reading Warhammer 40k Boltgun 2 will surprise you until the very end, says lead dev
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Warhammer 40k starter sets, Best W
title: Warhammer 40k Boltgun 2 will surprise you until the very end, says lead dev

author: Mollie Russell
description:
Board game lovers will find literally any excuse to bring their collection to a social gathering. It doesn’t matter what you had planned or how long we’re hanging out for; we can and will find a tabletop title that fits the bill. Case in point: I invited my board games to a music festival. I wanted to prove to my friends that a card game or two was a worthy addition to our camping gear.

Continue reading Yes, you can play board games at a music festival, but there will be casualties
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best board games , Couples' board games, Board games for adults
title: Yes, you can play board games at a music festival, but there will be casualties

author: Timothy Linward
description:
Since Magic the Gathering’s Final Fantasy set hit store shelves on June 13, the market price for copies of the powerful Enchantment card Sigarda’s Aid has risen by 100%, going from $8.50 on June 12 to $17 on June 25. The card is an excellent enabler for Equipment strategies that bypasses equip costs, and already has a home in Modern Hammer Time decks - but Final Fantasy has added such a slew of new cards that support Equipment that not only is it seeing extra play in Commander, it may be part of an up and coming Pioneer deck.

Continue reading Crucial MTG card for Equipment decks doubles in price after Final Fantasy launch
MORE FROM WARGAMER: All MTG sets in order, Upcoming MTG release dates,
title: Crucial MTG card for Equipment decks doubles in price after Final Fantasy launch

author: Timothy Linward
description:
The Star Wars Legion model for the A-A5 Speeder Truck will be available to pre-order from June 26, after a lengthy absence from store shelves. This hovering transport vehicle is used by both the Rebel Alliance and the mercenaries of the Shadow Collective, who have to make do with whatever armored support they can salvage together - which is why this supposed war-machine looks more like a Winnebago.

Continue reading Star Wars Legion's beloved A-A5 speeder truck is back in stock at last
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Star Wars board games, Star Wars Legion - release dates roadmap, Star Wars Shatterpoint review
title: Star Wars Legion's beloved A-A5 speeder truck is back in stock at last

author: Mollie Russell
description:
Pokémon Pocket launched its new Eevee Grove set on June 25, so there’s a sparkly new Crown Rare for fans to chase. Fans seem divided on whether they actually want this new card, however. The Crown Rare in question is Eevee Bag, an adorkable backpack based on the iconic Pokémon.

Continue reading Pokémon Pocket fans can't decide if the new Crown Rare is blessed or cursed
MORE FROM WARGAMER: How many Pokémon are there?, How to play Pokémon cards, Rare Pokémon cards
title: Pokémon Pocket fans can't decide if the new Crown Rare is blessed or cursed
